tool_description: Provides results from major european football (soccer) leagues.
name: Football Data
title: Football Data

api_list.name: League Standings
api_list.description:
The ***League Standings*** endpoint provides a comprehensive and up-to-date view of the current standings in various football leagues. When queried, it returns a detailed league table that includes key information such as:

**Points**: The total points accumulated by each team in the season thus far.
**Games Played**: The number of games each team has played.
**Wins, Draws, and Losses**: The number of wins, draws, and losses for each team.
**Goals Scored and Conceded:** The total number of goals scored by each team and the total number of goals conceded.

The data is structured to provide a clear understanding of how each team is performing in the current season, making it an invaluable resource for fans, analysts, and enthusiasts interested in football league statistics.

required_parameters.name: league
required_parameters.description:
The ***league*** parameter is essential for filtering match results by specific football leagues. It accepts predefined string values representing various top-tier football leagues. The parameter is case-sensitive and should match the exact format of the league identifiers. Supported values include:

***premierleague*** for the Premier League (England)
***laliga*** for La Liga (Spain)
***serie-a*** for Serie A (Italy)
***bundesliga*** for Bundesliga (Germany)
***ligue1*** for Ligue 1 (France)
***liganos*** for Liga NOS (Portugal)
***eredivisie*** for Eredivisie (Netherlands)
***russianpremierleague*** for the Russian Premier League (Russia)
***championsleague*** for the UEFA Champions League
***europaleague*** for the UEFA Europa League
Ensure that the value entered corresponds accurately to one of these league identifiers to retrieve the relevant match results.

optional_parameters.name: group
optional_parameters.description: The **group** parameter is required when requesting standings for the group stages of the Champions League and Europa League. In these competitions, standings exists during the group stage, as they determine which teams advance to the next round. When using this parameter, specify the group using capital letters, such as **A, B, C**, and so on. It is important to note that this parameter is case-sensitive, so the group letter must be entered in uppercase to ensure results

api_list.name: Matches Results
api_list.description:
The **Matches Results **API endpoint delivers summaries of football matches from various leagues, including results for matches that have already been played. Each entry in the response can include:

**Match Date and Time**: The scheduled time for upcoming matches or the actual time for completed matches (e.g., 'Saturday, Aug 19, 2023, 17:30'). All times are expressed in GMT.
**Teams**: Names of the competing teams. For matches that have been played, this includes their scores, both the final score and the score at the end of the first half.
**Match Status**: Indicates the status of the match, typically noting if the match is completed (e.g., 'FT' for Full Time).
**Venue**: The stadium where the match is held or was played.
**Attendance**: The number of spectators present, provided for some matches.
**Referee**: The match referee's name, included for some matches.
**Weather**: Weather conditions during the match, included for some matches.

The parameter is case-sensitive and should match the exact format of the league identifiers. Supported values include:

optional_parameters.name: team2
optional_parameters.description:
The **team2** parameter in the API is used to filter match data based on the away team. To effectively utilize this parameter, consider the following aspects:

**Accurate Name Entry**:  It's important to input the team name exactly as it is recognized by the API. This includes paying attention to the correct spelling and capitalization. The API may not use the official team names, so the exact name format recognized by the API should be determined through exploration or by consulting the API's documentation or data.
**Specific Naming Required**: The parameter is designed to accept the specific name of the team as recognized by the API. This means that common nicknames, synonyms, or alternate names for teams may not produce the desired results.
**Isolating Away Matches**: When used without other filters (except the mandatory ones), the *team2* parameter retrieves all matches where the specified team has played as the away team. This feature is particularly useful for users who wish to analyze the away game performance of a specific football team.

optional_parameters.name: data
optional_parameters.description: The date parameter is used to retrieve match results for a specific day. It should be provided as a string in the format **MMDDYYYY**. For example, to query results for August 19, 2023, enter the date as 08192023

optional_parameters.name: team1
optional_parameters.description:
The **team1** parameter in the API is used to filter match data based on the away team. To effectively utilize this parameter, consider the following aspects:

**Accurate Name Entry**:  It's important to input the team name exactly as it is recognized by the API. This includes paying attention to the correct spelling and capitalization. The API may not use the official team names, so the exact name format recognized by the API should be determined through exploration or by consulting the API's documentation or data.
**Specific Naming Required**: The parameter is designed to accept the specific name of the team as recognized by the API. This means that common nicknames, synonyms, or alternate names for teams may not produce the desired results.
**Isolating Home Matches**: When used without other filters (except the mandatory ones), the *team1* parameter retrieves all matches where the specified team has played as the home team. This feature is particularly useful for users who wish to analyze the home game performance of a specific football team.

optional_parameters.name: season
optional_parameters.description: The *season* parameter allows you to specify the football season for which you wish to retrieve match results. This parameter is optional; if not provided, the API will return results from the current season (currently the *2023-24* season). When specifying a season, use the format *YYYY-YY* to represent the start and end years of the season. For example 2015-16. If you are interested in historical data, this parameter enables you to access results from previous seasons as per the available data.

optional_parameters.name: week
optional_parameters.description:
The ***week*** parameter is a flexible tool designed to help users navigate through football match schedules based on weeks. It accepts integer values and operates as follows:

***0***: Use this value to retrieve matches for the current week. Our system defines a week as starting on Sunday and ending on Saturday.
**Negative Values** (***-1, -2***, etc.): These values are used to access matches from previous weeks. For example, *-1* fetches matches from the previous week, *-2* for the week before that, and so on.
**Positive Values** (***1, 2, 3***, etc.): These values are for exploring future matches. 1 will show matches for the next week, 2 for the week after next, and so forth.
This parameter is particularly useful when you don’t have specific details about the round or date of the matches. It allows for easy chronological navigation, letting users seamlessly move back and forth in the league's schedule to view past results or upcoming fixtures.

For UEFA leagues, such as the Champions League and Europa League, the first six rounds typically correspond to the group stage matches. In these cases, it's important to use the week parameter in conjunction with the group parameter to specify the group (e.g., A, B, C, etc.) you are interested in.

optional_parameters.name: matchday
optional_parameters.description:
The ***matchday*** parameter is used to specify the particular round of matches within a league season. It accepts an integer value representing the matchday or round number. For example, entering **1** would retrieve results from the first round of matches, **2 **for the second round, and so on.

For UEFA leagues, such as the Champions League and Europa League, the first six rounds typically correspond to the group stage matches. In these cases, it's important to use the *matchday* parameter in conjunction with the ***group*** parameter to specify the group (e.g., A, B, C, etc.) you are interested in. 

Please note that the *matchday* parameter is league-specific. The number of matchdays can vary between leagues, so it is important to know the structure of the league you are querying.

Check ***week*** parameter as an alternative way to iterate through league matches .

optional_parameters.name: group
optional_parameters.description: This parameter is required when requesting results for the **Champions League** and **Europa League** group stages. Specify the group using capital letters (e.g., **A**, **B**, **C**, etc.). Note that this parameter is case-sensitive.
